election_record.label: Pennsylvania 1817 Governor

sub_unit.name: Cumberland Valley
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 8 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Berks
sub_unit.note: The Lancaster Intelligencer, November 1 and 15, list 4183 votes for Joseph Hiester in Berks county. The November 15 edition notes that: "It is said that Mr. Hiester's whole vote, in Berks county, was 8 less than returned."
The American Daily Advertisers lists 4190 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Earl
sub_unit.note: Der Readinger Postbothe lists these returns as being from "Pannebeders."

sub_unit.name: Muthard's
sub_unit.note: The Berks and Schuylkill Journal (Reading, PA) and Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) list 60 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Alsace
sub_unit.note: The Northumberland Republicaner lists these returns as being from "Essex."

sub_unit.name: Cumru
sub_unit.note: The Northumberland Republicaner lists 70 votes for William Findlay.

sub_unit.name: Bradford
sub_unit.note: The Harrisburg Republican (Harrisburg, PA) lists 352 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Hilltown
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 151 votes for William Findlay.

sub_unit.name: Wrightstown
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 76 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Cambria
sub_unit.note: The History of Cambria lists 205 votes for William Findley.

sub_unit.name: Oxford
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press refers to Oxford as "Hoods."

sub_unit.name: Berwick
sub_unit.note: Some sources list these returns as being from "Briar Creek."

sub_unit.name: Bloom
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 141 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Liberty
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 155 votes for William Findlay and 41 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Limestone
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 23 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Dauphin
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 1138 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Harrisburg Republican (Harrisburg, PA) lists Joseph Heister with 1930 votes.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: The Reporter lists 1339 votes for William Findlay and 709 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Indiana and Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The Lancaster Intelligencer lists 748 votes for William Findlay.

sub_unit.name: Elizabeth
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists these returns as being from "Mountjoy."

sub_unit.name: Lancaster
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 270 votes for William Findlay.

sub_unit.name: New Holland
sub_unit.note: "In the Newholland district, Lancaster county, the votes for Mr. Hiester were 619, and not 690; the Return being incorrect." The Intelligencer, and Weekly Advertiser (Lancaster, PA). November 15, 1817. This is the only reference to a vote discrepancy, and the official canvass of votes lists 690 for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Lehigh
sub_unit.note: The Lancaster Intelligencer, the Journal of the Senate, and the Journal of the House list 1617 votes for William Findlay and 843 votes for Joseph Hiester.
The Democratic Press lists 1617 votes for William Findlay and 643 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 2643 votes for Joseph Hiester.
The Niles' Weekly Register (Baltimore, MD) lists 2654 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Northampton
sub_unit.note: The votes listed here add up to 2393 votes for William Findlay and 1107 for Joseph Hiester, though the official returns list 2761 votes for Findlay and 1203 for Heister.

sub_unit.name: Middle Mahonoy
sub_unit.note: Some sources list these returns as being from "Little Mahonoy."

sub_unit.name: Milton
sub_unit.note: Some sources list these returns as being from "Turbut."

sub_unit.name: Northumberland
sub_unit.note: Some sources list these returns as being from "Point."

sub_unit.name: Schamolin
sub_unit.note: Some sources list these returns as being from "Shamokin."

sub_unit.name: Sunbury
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists these returns as being from "Sunbury Augusta."

sub_unit.name: Philadelphia
sub_unit.note: The American Daily Advertiser lists 3956 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Cedar
sub_unit.note: The Relf's Philadelphia Gazette. And Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) lists 331 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: South
sub_unit.note: The American Daily Advertiser and the Relf's Philadelphia Gazette. And Daily Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA) list 250 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Philadelphia
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press lists 3527 votes for Joseph Hiester.
The Reporter lists 3007 votes for William Findlay and 3444 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Blockley
sub_unit.note: The Democratic Press, October 18, lists these returns as "Blockley and Kingsessing."

sub_unit.name: Northern Liberties
sub_unit.note: Though the votes from the East and West Northern Liberties add up to 1167, the Democratic Press, October 18, lists 1171 votes.

sub_unit.name: Pike
sub_unit.note: The Niles' Weekly Register (Baltimore, MD), the Journal of the Senate, and the Journal of the House list 112 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Schuylkill
sub_unit.note: Der Readinger Adler (Reading, PA) lists 840 votes for Joseph Hiester.

sub_unit.name: Susquehanna
sub_unit.note: "The following republican majorities are taken from the official returns of last evening. Majority for Findlay (Governor) is 311." The Susquehanna Centinel (Montrose, PA). October 18, 1817.

sub_unit.name: New Berlin
sub_unit.note: The Annals of Buffalo Valley lists these returns as being from Union TownshiNew Berlin was part of Union Township until 1837.

sub_unit.name: Schweinfordst
sub_unit.note: The Annals of Buffalo lists these returns as being from "Centre."

sub_unit.name: Selinsgrove
sub_unit.note: The Annals of Buffalo lists these returns as being from "Penn's."

sub_unit.name: Stroupstown
sub_unit.note: The Annals of Buffalo lists these returns as being from "Freeburg."

sub_unit.name: Westmoreland
sub_unit.note: The Niles' Weekly Register (Baltimore, MD) lists 1481 votes for Joseph Hiester.
